ALL THE WAY.Definition: to the full or entire extent : as far as possible

BARELY.Definition: by the smallest amount; only just

ADOPTED.Definition: to take an animal that has been left in a place such as a rescue center, and keep it as your pet

SHELTER.Definition: something that gives protection, such as a building or tent, or the protection provided

PROFESSIONS.Definition: any type of work that needs special training or a particular skill, often one that is respected because it involves a high level of education

GIVE BACK.Definition: to provide help or financial assistance to others in appreciation of one's own success or good fortune

NON-PROFIT.Definition: an organization whose most important goal is something that does not involve making a profit

POSSESSIONS.Definition: something that you own or that you are carrying with you at a particular time

HOMELESS.Definition: people who do not have a home, usually because they are poor

LITERALLY.Definition: used to emphasize what you are saying

PULL OVER.Definition: if a vehicle pulls over, it moves to the side of the road and stops

TRUNK.Definition: a covered space at the back of a car, for storing things in

I KNOW, RIGHT?.Definition: said to show that you agree with something that someone has just said

INSTILLED.Definition: to put a feeling, idea, or principle gradually into someone's mind, so that it has a strong influence on the way that person thinks or behaves

TAKE ADVANTAGE.Definition: to treat someone badly in order to get something good from them

RECIPROCATE.Definition: to share the same feelings as someone else, or to behave in the same way as someone else

GIVE PEOPLE THE BENEFIT OF THE DOUBT.Definition: to believe something good about someone, rather than something bad, when you have the possibility of doing either

MY GOODNESS.Definition: used to express any strong emotion, especially surprise

EXPECT.Definition: to think or believe something will happen

WILLINGNESS.Definition: the quality of being happy to do something if it is needed

UNGRATEFUL.Definition: not showing or expressing any thanks

GRATITUDE.Definition: a strong feeling of appreciation to someone or something for what the person has done to help you

APPRECIATING.Definition: to be grateful for something; to be aware of something, or to understand that something is valuable
